version_description:
- New Japanese language version of Manything
- New 'Alert on sound' setting, currently in beta and available under developer settings
- New 'Delete All' so you can delete all of your motion events at once
- General improvements in camera reliability
All feedback welcome, let us know what you think!

- New Japanese language version of Manything
- New 'Alert on sound’ setting, currently in beta and available under developer settings
- New 'Delete All’ so you can delete all of your motion events at once
- General improvements in camera reliability
All feedback welcome, let us know what you think!

- New Japanese language version of Manything
- New 'Alert on sound’ setting, currently in beta and available under developer settings
- New 'Delete All’ so you can delete all of your motion events at once
- General improvements in camera reliability
- Fixed problem where the settings screen was appearing in Japanese
All feedback welcome, let us know what you think!

New sharing options - share an image, a file or a link to your motion events straight from the app.
Fixes- Important camera fixes to solve the lost audio bug

Need more eyeballs on your Manything camera?  Now you can ask your friends and family to keep an eye on your house or pet, or broadcast amazing footage to the internet by enabling Facebook Live sharing from your Manything camera.  We've also improved camera stability and sped up the time to connect to your live stream by 10x.  Do get in touch with any feedback.  Happy Monitoring!

Need more eyeballs on your Manything camera?  Now you can ask your friends and family to keep an eye on your house or pet, or broadcast amazing footage to the internet by enabling Facebook Live sharing from your Manything camera.  We've also improved camera stability and sped up the time to connect to your live stream by 10x.  Plus an iOS 10 bug fix in viewer mode.  Do get in touch with any feedback.  Happy Monitoring!

- Improved connection to your camera's live stream when there’s limited bandwidth.
- There's a new option under 'Advanced' settings to keep recording even when the network connection is lost. Recorded events are stored on the camera and automatically uploaded when network connection is regained.
- If your camera is recording over a cellular network and you’re worried about data usage, there’s a new settings option so that only your live stream is sent over the cellular network. Recorded events are stored on the camera and uploaded when you’re re-connected to wifi.
Do get in touch with any feedback. Happy Monitoring!

- Improved connection to your camera's live stream when there’s limited bandwidth.
- There's a new option under 'Advanced' settings to keep recording even when the network connection is lost. Recorded events are stored on the camera and automatically uploaded when network connection is regained.
- If your camera is recording over a cellular network and you’re worried about data usage, there’s a new settings option so that only your live stream is sent over the cellular network. Recorded events are stored on the camera and uploaded when you’re re-connected to wifi.
Do get in touch with any feedback. Happy Monitoring!
Camera bug fixes

Remote rename of your cameras
Updated interface to Facebook (old interface becomes obsolete)
Various bug fixes

Various bug fixes to the Viewer
(no changes to Camera)
Bug fixes and enhancements

We've fixed a couple of known bugs with this update - thanks to the users who identified them!

- The app no longer freezes when it can't load a video due to poor network conditions, a pop up is now displayed much quicker than before
- You can now set 'Stills Interval' when in Record on Motion mode for all devices

Plus some other crash fixes to make the app run smoothly.

Happy Monitoring!

Sorry folks...no changes to the app in this version, just a small change to the App Store listing which now needs to be submitted as an app update.

Keep your eyes peeled for an update coming soon with lots of new features!

This update has a swanky new feature AND a juicy bug fix…

New feature: Let us introduce the ‘Date Picker' - instead of scrolling through a list of recorded events you can now select a date on the calendar and shoot straight back to it. Our Manythingers with 30 days cloud storage will thank us for this one!

Bug fix: Say goodbye to our number 1 bug! At Manything HQ we’ve affectionately named it the ‘Stuck Chunks Bug’ and it’s been driving us crazy. If you’ve been an unlucky victim you’ve probably received a motion alert and found that the recorded event is missing when you go to view it, annoying huh?! Well, we have good news - it’s fixed!

As always, let us know your feedback.

Happy Monitoring :)

This update has a swanky new feature AND a juicy bug fix…

New feature: Let us introduce the ‘Date Picker' - instead of scrolling through a list of recorded events you can now select a date on the calendar and shoot straight back to it. Our Manythingers with 30 days cloud storage will thank us for this one!

Bug fix: Say goodbye to our number 1 bug! At Manything HQ we’ve affectionately named it the ‘Stuck Chunks Bug’ and it’s been driving us crazy. If you’ve been an unlucky victim you’ve probably received a motion alert and found that the recorded event is missing when you go to view it, annoying huh?! Well, we have good news - it’s fixed!

As always, let us know your feedback.

Happy Monitoring :)

Two key updates for you this time, we hope you like them!

1) Your video has had a growth spurt! When you watch your live video or recorded events you’ll notice that the video is now larger and uses more of the screen space.

2) Get up close and personal with zoom! You can now zoom into your live or recorded video, just double tap or pinch to get closer to the action.

Happy Monitoring :)

Just some tweaks to the layout and a couple of bug fixes this time around.

Happy Monitoring :)

Happy New Year from everyone at Manything! Here are our latest updates:

- For subscribers with multiple cameras…we’ve jazzed up the UI on the multi camera view and spoilt you with 3 different options, just tap the icon to switch between them. You can also hide or rearrange the cameras - just long press on one of your cameras to give it a try. 

- For jet setting Manythingers…video event times are now displayed in the time zone of the camera rather than the phone you are watching them from, thanks for your patience on this one :)

- And finally, for fancy Manythingers…the iPhone X is now fully supported!
Just a few bug fixes this time, but more new features coming soon!
Just a few bug fixes this time, but more new features coming soon!
This update fixes a problem recording or viewing 'live' video after your camera has been updated to iOS 11.3.
A few more bug fixes, more new features coming soon!
Just a bug fix this time, new features coming soon!
This update fixes a problem recording or viewing 'live' video after your camera has been updated to iOS 11.3.
Good news for those using Manything with Hikvision cameras - if your  camera has an internal microphone or an AUX input you can now record  sound. Just go to the settings menu and flip the switch!
Updated to fix a bug which was causing the app to crash when the 'talk' feature was used on iOS 12 - thanks to the users who let us know about it :)
iOS 13 fixes.

You can now add professional CCTV cameras to Manything. All you need is a Cloud Adapter - no bigger than a deck of cards, this little device will connect up to 8 cameras to the cloud. All key features, such as camera live view, event recording (with a cloud plan), remote camera control and downloading video, are now available for CCTV cameras as well as your spare smartphones.
